Welcome to the California Homebrew Circuit (CHBC)

The CHBC is a free, community-driven initiative connecting homebrewers across California through friendly competition, shared learning, and cross-club collaboration.

Our mission is to strengthen the California homebrew scene by promoting local competitions, building friendships, and making brewing more connected and fun.

entry.content:
Methodology

The California Homebrew Circuit (CHBC) is a free, community-driven initiative connecting homebrewers across the state through friendly competition, shared learning, and cross-club collaboration.

How Competitions Are Selected

To be included in the CHBC standings, competitions must meet the following criteria:

  • BJCP-Sanctioned: Only competitions sanctioned by the Beer Judge Certification Program (BJCP) are considered.
  • California-Based: The competition must be held within the state of California.
  • Open and Inclusive: Events must be accessible to the broader homebrewing community.
  • Standard Format: Specialty competitions limited to specific styles, ingredients, or themes are not eligible.
  • Results Transparency: Competitions must publicly share complete results using a standardized format (e.g., table with brewer, category, beer name, and medal).

Each season, we aim to include 12‚Äì16 well-established and geographically diverse competitions. Selection favors events with a history of strong participation, fair judging, and reliable results reporting.

Scoring System

We use a standardized point system based on medal placements:

  • Gold ‚Äì 3 points
  • Silver ‚Äì 2 points
  • Bronze ‚Äì 1 point

Points are awarded to individual brewers (or co-brewers) per placing entry. Best of Show and special awards may be highlighted but are not weighted differently in the leaderboard.

If a competition includes a ‚ÄúDouble Gold‚Äù or similar designation, it is counted as a single Gold placement unless clarified otherwise by the organizer.

Data Collection

Results are gathered from:

  • Publicly posted competition result sheets (PDF, Google Sheets, HTML, etc.)
  • Direct communication with competition coordinators
  • Club announcements and newsletters

Efforts are made to verify accuracy and to attribute points to the correct individuals and clubs. If you spot an error or omission, please contact us and we‚Äôll correct it promptly.

Result Standardization

To ensure fairness and consistency across the circuit, all competitions must publish results that:

  • Clearly identify brewers, beer names, BJCP categories/subcategories, and award placements
  • Be available via public link, official website, or verifiable documentation
  • Be posted in a timely manner following the event

CHBC reserves the right to delay or exclude competitions from the current season if results are incomplete, unverifiable, or posted in nonstandard formats.

Timeline

The current season runs from January 1 to December 31, 2025. Results are updated monthly (or as competitions report).
